Detailed Description

A Layout where the positions of the children can be described in relation to each other or to the parent.

Note that you cannot have a circular dependency between the size of the RelativeController and the position of its children. For example, you cannot have a RelativeController whose height is set to WRAP_CONTENT and a child set to ALIGN_PARENT_BOTTOM.

 RelativeController* rl = new RelativeController(this);
 TextWidget* tw = new TextWidget(this);
 tw->setId(1);
 tw->setText("Hello World");
 TextWidget* tw2 = new TextWidget(this);
 tw->setId(2);
 tw2->setText("Hello World2");
 RelativeControllerParams* rlp = new RelativeControllerParams(
 ControllerParams::WRAP_CONTENT, ControllerParams::WRAP_CONTENT);
 rlp->setRelation(RelativeControllerParams::ALIGN_PARENT_TOP);
 RelativeControllerParams* rlp2 = new RelativeControllerParams(
 ControllerParams::WRAP_CONTENT, ControllerParams::WRAP_CONTENT);
 rlp2->setRelation(RelativeControllerParams::BELOW, 1);
 rl->addWidget(tw, rlp);
 rl->addWidget(tw2, rlp2);

Member Function Documentation

int32_t gaia::ui::RelativeController::getBaseline ( )

If this widget does not support baseline alignment, this method returns -1.

Return the offset of the widget's text baseline from the widget's top boundary.

void gaia::ui::RelativeController::setIgnoreGravity ( int32_t  viewId)

Defines which View is ignored when the gravity is applied.

This setting has no effect if the gravity is Gravity.LEFT | Gravity.TOP.

void gaia::ui::RelativeController::setVerticalGravity ( int32_t  verticalGravity)

Set vertical gravity.
